title: Back Pain
q1: Do you have lower back pain?
q2: Have you had your symptoms for the first time or not the first time, but most recently over 8 weeks ago?
q3: Was the onset of back pain suddenly and abruptly (e.g. after a wrong movement)?
q4: Did the back pain occur after a certain movement, i.e. with a recognizable cause?
q5: Do you work more than 4 hours a day while sitting?
q6: Do you have shooting pain in the back or leg during certain movements?
q7: Do your pains radiate into your buttocks or legs?
q8: Do you have any other symptoms?
q9: When did the first symptom appear ?
q10: How many days do you feel unable to work/go to school?
risk-desc: If you have any of the following risks, unfortunately, you will not be able to use our service. If you are in doubt or if you do not understand a question, please answer 'yes' for your safety.
qr1: Did your back pain appear after an accident (fall, car accident, etc)?
qr2: Do you have a fever above 37.5Â° C ?
qr3: Do you have problems with bowel movements or urination? (e.g. unable to urinate or inability to hold back stool or urine?)
qr4: Do you have a feeling disorder in the buttocks or the region between the anus and the genitals?
qr5: Do you have clear numbness or tingling in the buttocks or legs or very severe pain?
qr6: Do you have back pain between the navel and neck?
qr7: Do you have any of these symptoms?
qr8: Do you have a significant loss of strength or paralysis in one leg?
qr9: Does the pain radiate in both legs?
qr10: Have you had an infection in the past 2 weeks (recognizable, for example, from chills, fever, loss of appetite, or fatigue)?
qr11: Please tiptoe straight 3 meters, i.e. your heels do not touch the ground. Do you have problems doing this with both feet equally?
qr12: Do you meet one of these exclusion criteria?
qr13: Do you take certain medicine for more than a month?
